body_html:
I’m not sure why Xcode 8.1 could not support iPhone simulator with CNN function, but Apple original CNN example does not work on simulators and could not build app. Then it’s working on real device only.

So, I wonder Tensorflow also could not run on simulators.
I modified the following sh files for disabling simulator build.

compile_ios_protobuf.sh
compile_ios_tensorflow.sh

I deleted “make” part for build and “lipo” part for archive lib file to the following directory related.
${LIBDIR}/iossim_386/
${LIBDIR}/iossim_x86_64/

After modified I run “build_all_ios.sh” for building to ${LIBDIR}/ libtensorflow-core.a .
That sh called two modified sh files.

The modified sh build libtensorflow-core.a without simulator libs.
But It run on the real iPhone device.
…I run camera ios_example on iPhone 6 plus iOS 10.1.1
used environment : macOS Sierra 10.12.1, and Xcode 8.1 with command line tools 8.1

Please try above for fixing configure issue in build phase.

body:
I’m not sure why Xcode 8.1 could not support iPhone simulator with CNN function, but Apple original CNN example does not work on simulators and could not build app. Then it’s working on real device only.

So, I wonder Tensorflow also could not run on simulators.
I modified the following sh files for disabling simulator build.

compile_ios_protobuf.sh
compile_ios_tensorflow.sh

I deleted “make” part for build and “lipo” part for archive lib file to the following directory related. 
${LIBDIR}/iossim_386/
${LIBDIR}/iossim_x86_64/

After modified I run “build_all_ios.sh” for building to  ${LIBDIR}/ libtensorflow-core.a .
That sh called two modified sh files.

The modified sh build libtensorflow-core.a without simulator libs.
But It run on the real iPhone device.
 …I run camera ios_example on iPhone 6 plus iOS 10.1.1
    used environment : macOS Sierra 10.12.1, and Xcode 8.1 with command line tools 8.1

Please try above for fixing configure issue in build phase.
